title: Investigations in Gastroenterology
description: (1) To provide basic anatomy and physiology knowledge in relation to the investigations of gastrointestinal disorders(2) To provide knowledge on the use and interpretation of laboratory investigations(3) To enable students to understand the principles on diagnostic endoscopy(4) To provide an overview of medical imaging in gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary diseases(5) To illustrate with clinical examples the role of imaging in different kinds of gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary conditions(6) To provide understanding on special investigations such as manometry and fibroscan
outcome: 1) Understand the basic anatomy and physiology knowledge in relation to the investigations of gastrointestinal disorders. 2) Understand knowledge on the use and interpretation of laboratory investigations. 3) Understand the principles on diagnostic endoscopy. 4) Appreciate the overview of medical imaging in gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary diseases. 5) Appreciate the role of imaging in different kinds of gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary conditions. 6) Understand special investigations such as manometry and fibro scan.
syllabus: Course Topics:  - Basic science of the digestive system - Principles of diagnostic endoscopy - Small bowel investigations - Imaging studies in gastrointestinal diseases - Imaging studies in hepatobiliary diseases  - Workup of gastrointestinal malignancies  - Assessment of liver

title: Interventions and Pharmacology in Gastroenterology
description: (1) To illustrate the role on therapeutic endoscopy(2) To understand the basic principles of gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary surgery(3) To illustrate the role of minimally invasive interventional radiology on treatment of gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary disorders(4) To provide an overview of interventional radiology in gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary disorders(5) To provide knowledge on the clinical pharmacology in gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary disorders
outcome: 1) Appreciate the role on therapeutic endoscopy. 2) Understand the basic principles of gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary surgery. 3) Appreciate the role of minimally invasive interventional radiology on treatment of gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary disorders. 4) Appreciate the overview of interventional radiology in gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary disorders. 5) Understand knowledge on the clinical pharmacology in gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary disorders.
syllabus: Course Topics: - Basic principles of gastrointestinal surgery  - Endoscopic therapies in early gastrointestinal malignancies  - Pharmacology: Immunosuppressive and Biologics - Endoscopic therapies in gastrointestinal bleeding - Endoscopic therapies in hepatobiliary disorders  - Basic principles of hepatobiliary surgery  - Intervention radiology in GI and hepatobiliary diseases - Pharmacology: Therapies in peptic ulcer disease and functional GI disorders  - Pharmacology: Cirrhosis and complications  - Pharmacology: GI and hepatobiliary infection

title: Nutrition and Dietetics
description: (1) To provide basic knowledge on the physiology from absorption to metabolism of nutrients(2) To provide an overview on food and nutrition(3) To establish foundation knowledge for nutrition intervention in different disease groups
outcome: 1) Understand basic knowledge on the physiology from absorption to metabolism of nutrients. 2) Appreciate the overview on food and nutrition. 3) Understand foundation knowledge for nutrition intervention in different disease groups.
syllabus: Course Topics:  - Obesity - the scope of problem - Basic food science - Gastrointestinal physiology - digestion and absorption of nutrients - Obesity - the multidisciplinary management - Malnutrition and clinical manifestations  - Clinical assessment of nutritional status - Enteral nutrition - the science and clinical practice  - Parenteral nutrition - pros and cons - Dietary management in patients with benign gastrointestinal pathologies - Perioperative dietary management in surgical patients - Dietary supplement in patients with chronic liver failure - Probiotics and the gastrointestinal tract

title: Upper Gastrointestinal Diseases
description: (1) To provide the basic knowledge about the pathophysiology of benign and malignant upper gastrointestinal diseases(2) To understand the clinical presentation and diagnostic strategies to various upper gastrointestinal diseases(3) To understand the management of benign and malignant upper gastrointestinal diseases(4) To illustrate with clinical examples and videos on the management of upper gastrointestinal diseases
outcome: 1) Understand the basic knowledge about the pathophysiology of benign and malignant upper gastrointestinal diseases. 2) Understand the clinical presentation and diagnostic strategies to various upper gastrointestinal diseases. 3) Understand the management of benign and malignant upper gastrointestinal diseases. 4) Appreciate the management of upper gastrointestinal diseases.
syllabus: Course Topics:  - Anatomy of the upper gastrointestinal anatomy  - Physiology of the upper gastrointestinal tract - Gastrointestinal reflux disease  - Investigatory modalities for diseases of upper gastrointestinal tract - Peptic ulcer disease and gastritis - Acute upper gastrointestinal bleeding - Benign oesophageal diseases - Oesophageal cancers - Investigations of chronic bleeding in the upper gastrointestinal tract - Gastric cancer and its management

title: Liver, Hepato-biliary, and Pancreatic Diseases
description: (1) To understand the basic pathologies of hepatitis, hepato-biliary and pancreatic diseases(2) To understand the common clinical presentations of different liver parenchymal, hepato-biliary and pancreatic conditions using a multidisciplinary approach(3) To illustrate with clinical examples the clinical management of viral hepatitis, common hepato-biliary and pancreatic condition(4) To provide an overview on office management of viral hepatitis, common hepato-biliary and pancreatic diseases
outcome: 1) Understand the basic pathologies of hepatitis, hepato-biliary and pancreatic diseases. 2) Understand the common clinical presentations of different liver parenchymal, hepato-biliary and pancreatic conditions using a multidisciplinary approach. 3) Appreciate clinical management of viral hepatitis, common hepato-biliary and pancreatic condition. 4) Appreciate the overview on office management of viral hepatitis, common hepato-biliary and pancreatic diseases.
syllabus: Course Topics: - Acute viral hepatitis - Chronic viral hepatitis  - Fatty liver diseases - Drug induced and metabolic liver disorders - Liver failure and transplantation - Hepatitis and renal patients - Hepatitis and oncology patients - Hepatitis and pregnancy - Gallstone and cholangitis - Hepatobiliary malignancies - Pancreatitis

title: Small Bowel and Colonic Diseases
description: (1) To provide a basic knowledge about etiology and pathophysiology of various benign and malignant small bowel and colorectal diseases(2) To provide a general knowledge about different clinical presentations and principles of diagnosis of benign and malignant colorectal diseases (3) To illustrate with clinical scenarios and case studies the management of benign and malignant colorectal diseases using a multidisciplinary approach(4) To provide a brief overview of cancer screening, using colorectal cancer as an example
outcome: 1) Understand a basic knowledge about etiology and pathophysiology of various benign and malignant small bowel and colorectal diseases. 2) Understand a general knowledge about different clinical presentations and principles of diagnosis of benign and malignant colorectal diseases. 3) Appreciate the management of benign and malignant colorectal diseases using a multidisciplinary approach. 4) Appreciate the overview of cancer screening, using colorectal cancer as an example.
syllabus: Course Topics: - Maldigestion and malabsorption - Infectious diarrhea and bacterial food poisoning - Functional bowel disorder and non-infectious enteritis - Inflammatory bowel disease - Pediatrics GI disorders - Non-malignant surgical bowel conditions - Small bowel and Colonic tumor

title: Psychological Intervention, Counseling and Complementary Medicine
description: (1) To introduce the concept of biopsychosocial model in development of functional gastrointestinal disorders(2) To provide an understanding on the relationship between psychological disorders and gastrointestinal diseases(3) To provide an overview of the role of psychological intervention and psychotropic therapy in management of functional gastrointestinal disorders(4) To provide basic training on the clinical skills of diagnosis and management of patients with functional gastrointestinal and psychological disorders(5) To provide an understanding on the role of complementary and alternative medicine in management of digestive diseases
outcome: 1) Understand the concept of biopsychosocial model in development of functional gastrointestinal disorders. 2) Understand the relationship between psychological disorders and gastrointestinal diseases. 3) Appreciate the overview of the role of psychological intervention and psychotropic therapy in management of functional gastrointestinal disorders. 4) Appreciate the basic training on the clinical skills of diagnosis and management of patients with functional gastrointestinal and psychological disorders. 5) Appreciate the the role of complementary and alternative medicine in management of digestive diseases.
syllabus: Course Topics:  - Overview of common mental disorders - Screening and risk assessment of mental disorders - Rating scales and questionnaires of mental disorders - Principles and management of common psychological disorders I - Principles and management of common psychological disorders II - Principles and practice of cognitive behavioral therapy I - Principles and practice of cognitive behavioral therapy II - Principles and practice of counseling I - Principles and practice of counseling II - Overview of Traditional Chinese Medicine in gastrointestinal diseases - Mindfulness-based management of gastrointestinal diseases

title: Interactive Workshops - Practical Management of Common GI Diseases
description: (1) To understand about the management of common GI diseases through interactive based learning(2) To illustrate the management of common GI diseases through case discussion(3) To learn the differential diagnosis and management of common GI diseases through sessions of interactive quiz(4) To understand and expose to various devices for investigation of common GI diseases through hands-on sessions
outcome: 1) Understand about the management of common GI diseases through interactive based learning. 2) Appreciate the management of common GI diseases through case discussion. 3) Understand the differential diagnosis and management of common GI diseases through sessions of interactive quiz. 4) Understand and expose to various devices for investigation of common GI diseases through hands-on sessions.
syllabus: Course Topics:  - Traveler's medicine - Acute abdominal pain - Anemia - Perianal problems - Liver function derangement - Liver nodule - Dyspepsia and chronic abdominal pain

title: Medical Ethics, Communication, and Law
description: (1) To provide an understanding of ethics and law relating to the field of healthcare (2) To develop skills in problem-solving and reasoning, teamwork, written and oral communication(3) To enable students to understand ethical and medico-legal issues that will be encountered during their professional lives, and to develop the skills necessary to resolve real-world ethical and medico-legal dilemmas.
outcome: 1) Understand ethics and law relating to the field of healthcare. 2) Able to develop skills in problem-solving and reasoning, teamwork, written and oral communication. 3) Understand ethical and medico-legal issues.
syllabus: Course Topics: - Ethics and law 1 - medical professionalism and consent for treatment - Ethics and law 2- confidentiality and clinical negligence - Ethics and law - end of life issues and advance directives - Healthcare law in Hong Kong - Expert witness - Complaints and disciplinary proceedings - Mediations - Medical documentation, record keeping and information technology - Ethical decision making - Problem solving skills for healthcare professionals - Complain Management - Media Management

title: Health Service Management & Healthcare Administration
description: (1) To provide basic knowledge on the administrative set-up of a hospital(2) To provide understanding in clinical governance, risk management, standard of care, health informatics and ethics in healthcare management(3) To educate the managerial and administrative skills, leadership and decision making as a healthcare manager
outcome: 1) Understand basic knowledge on the administrative set-up of a hospital. 2) Understand clinical governance, risk management, standard of care, health informatics and ethics in healthcare management. 3) Able to develop the managerial and administrative skills, leadership and decision making as a healthcare manager.
syllabus: Course Topics:  - Clinical governance - Audit, appraisal and revalidation - Hospital accreditation - Health informatics - Managing financial resources in healthcare - Quality, process management, patient safety in healthcare and risk management - Ethics in healthcare management - Concepts of health promotion - Human resource management - Health organization - theory and management - Behavioral and cultural issues in healthcare - Strategic planning and marketing in healthcare

title: Professional Communication Workshop
description: To provide students with advanced didactic and clinical education, knowledge and skills and enable them to utilize these extended and expanded skills and knowledge to widen their scope of practice in GI diseases and hepatology. Practical skills such as biofeedback, manometry, fibroscan, diagnostic and therapeutic endoscopy form an integral part of the course.
outcome: 1) Understand how to coordinate a multidisciplinary team in managing patients with digestive disease. 2) Understand how to communicate with patients and their family members. 3) Understand how to deal with PR crisis and how to communicate with journalists.
syllabus: Course Topics:  - Coordination of multidisciplinary team in managing patients with digestive disease - Perspective of a doctor - Coordination of multidisciplinary team in managing patients with digestive disease - Perspective of a nurse - Patient communication skills - Effective interviewing skills - Effective meeting and presentation - Managing health care team

title: Project
description: To develop the skills of addressing a clinical problem in a scientific and systematic approach.Through supervised clinical research, students can develop the ability to understand and criticize the evidence in the literature.
outcome: To develop the skills of addressing a clinical problem in a scientific and systematic approach. Through supervised clinical research, students can develop the ability to understand and criticize the evidence in the literature.

title: Epidemiology & Clinical Research
requirements: Only for students of Master of Science in Gastroenterology
description: (1) To describe the basic epidemiological theories and the methods of clinical investigation for scientific research(2) To educate the statistical concepts and data analysis methods for clinical and health economic research(3) To demonstrate the real scenarios of academic research in digestive disease(4) To demonstrate the procedures of data handling and statistical analysis in SPSS(5) To provide a practical experience of using SPSS(6) To introduce the theoretical issues and approaches to scientific research(7) To equip the students with the skills of research planning, protocol writing, and ethics consideration in digestive diseases(8) To coach for the literature reviews of clinical evidence from academic databases, and the skills of critical appraisal for the existing evidence
outcome: 1. Appreciate the principles of clinical research methodology; 2. Understand how to critically appraise scientific work in related fields; 3. Able to apply the advanced knowledge and experience in their professional fields.
syllabus: 1. Appreciate the principles of clinical research methodology; 2. Understand how to critically appraise scientific work in related fields; 3. Able to apply the advanced knowledge and experience in their professional fields.

title: Cellular and Molecular Gastroenterology
description: This course aims to review state-of-the-art cellular and molecular biology research that sheds new light on the pathogenesis of gastrointestinal (GI) and liver diseases and to introduce common techniques and novel technologies in laboratory research.

title: Epidemiology, Biostatistics & Health Economics
description: (1) To describe the basic epidemiological theories and the methods of clinical investigation for scientific research(2) To educate the statistical concepts and data analysis methods for clinical and health economic research(3) To demonstrate the real scenarios of academic research in digestive disease

title: Interactive Statistics/Scientific Report Writing Workshop
description: (1) To demonstrate the procedures of data handling and statistical analysis in SPSS(2) To provide a practical experience of using SPSS

title: Clinical Trial Research Methodology
description: (1) To introduce the theoretical issues and approaches to scientific research(2) To equip the students with the skills of research planning, protocol writing, and ethics consideration in digestive diseases(3) To coach for the literature reviews of clinical evidence from academic databases, and the skills of critical appraisal for the existing evidence
